082/**
083 *  Library of utility methods that are useful when dealing with Strings. <br>
084 *  <br>Parts of the code were adopted from the class
085 *  <code>org.apache.commons.lang.StringUtils</code> and modified to match the
086 *  requirements of this project. In particular, these are the methods
087 *  <ul>
088 *  <li>{@link #abbreviate(CharSequence, int) abbreviate()}</li>
089 *  <li>{@link #capitalize(CharSequence) capitalize()}</li>
090 *  <li>{@link #escapeHTML(CharSequence) escapeHTML()} in both versions</li>
091 *  <li>{@link #isEmpty(CharSequence) isEmpty()}</li>
092 *  <li>{@link #isNotEmpty(CharSequence) isNotEmpty()}</li>
093 *  <li>{@link #repeat(CharSequence, int) repeat()}</li>
094 *  <li>{@link #uncapitalize(CharSequence) uncapitalize()}</li>
095 *  <li>{@link #unescapeHTML(CharSequence) unescapeHTML()} in both versions</li>
096 *  </ul>
097 *
098 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
099 *  @version $Id: StringUtils.java 925 2021-05-24 19:53:39Z tquadrat $
100 *  @since 0.0.3
101 *
102 *  @UMLGraph.link
103 */
104@SuppressWarnings( {"ClassWithTooManyMethods", "OverlyComplexClass"} )
105@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: StringUtils.java 925 2021-05-24 19:53:39Z tquadrat $" )
106@UtilityClass
107public final class StringUtils
108{
109        /*---------------*\
110    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
111        \*---------------*/
112    /**
113     *  The clipping mode that is used for the method
114     *  {@link StringUtils#pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,Clipping)}
115     *
116     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
117     *  @version $Id: StringUtils.java 925 2021-05-24 19:53:39Z tquadrat $
118     *  @since 0.0.3
119     *
120     *  @UMLGraph.link
121     */
122    @SuppressWarnings( "InnerClassTooDeeplyNested" )
123    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: StringUtils.java 925 2021-05-24 19:53:39Z tquadrat $" )
124    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
125    public static enum Clipping
126    {
127            /*------------------*\
128        ====** Enum Declaration **=============================================
129            \*------------------*/
130        /**
131         *  If an input String is already longer than the target length, it
132         *  will be returned unchanged.
133         */
134        CLIPPING_NONE
135        {
136            /**
137             *  {@inheritDoc}
138             */
139            @Override
140            protected final String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length ) { return s.toString(); }
141        },
142
143        /**
144         *  If an input String is longer than the target length, it will be
145         *  just shortened to that length.
146         */
147        CLIPPING_CUT
148        {
149            /**
150             *  {@inheritDoc}
151             */
152            @Override
153            protected final String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length )
154            {
155                final var retValue = (s.length() > length ? s.subSequence( 0, length ) : s).toString();
156
157                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
158                return retValue;
159            }   //  clip()
160        },
161
162        /**
163         *  If an input String is longer than the target length, it will be
164         *  abbreviated to that length, by calling
165         *  {@link StringUtils#abbreviate(CharSequence, int)}
166         *  with that String. The minimum length for the padded String is 4.
167         */
168        CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE
169        {
170            /**
171             *  {@inheritDoc}
172             */
173            @Override
174            protected final String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length ) { return abbreviate( s, length ); }
175        },
176
177        /**
178         *  If an input String is longer than the target length, it will be
179         *  abbreviated to that length, by calling
180         *  {@link StringUtils#abbreviateMiddle(CharSequence, int)}
181         *  with that String. The minimum length for the padded String is 5.
182         */
183        CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE
184        {
185            /**
186             *  {@inheritDoc}
187             */
188            @Override
189            protected final String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length ) { return abbreviateMiddle( s, length ); }
190        };
191
192            /*---------*\
193        ====** Methods **======================================================
194            \*---------*/
195        /**
196         *  Clips the given input String.
197         *
198         *  @param  s   The input String.
199         *  @param  length  The target length.
200         *  @return The result String.
201         */
202        protected abstract String clip( final CharSequence s, final int length );
203    }
204    //  enum Clipping
205
206    /**
207     *  The padding mode that is used for the methods
208     *  {@link StringUtils#pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,boolean)}
209     *  and
210     *  {@link StringUtils#pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,Clipping)}
211     *
212     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
213     *  @version $Id: StringUtils.java 925 2021-05-24 19:53:39Z tquadrat $
214     *  @since 0.0.5
215     *
216     *  @UMLGraph.link
217     */
218    @SuppressWarnings( "InnerClassTooDeeplyNested" )
219    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: StringUtils.java 925 2021-05-24 19:53:39Z tquadrat $" )
220    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
221    public static enum Padding
222    {
223            /*------------------*\
224        ====** Enum Declaration **=============================================
225            \*------------------*/
226        /**
227         *  The pad characters are distributed evenly at begin and end of the
228         *  string.
229         */
230        PADDING_CENTER
231        {
232            /**
233             *  {@inheritDoc}
234             */
235            @Override
236            protected final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int padSize, final char c )
237            {
238                final var rightSize = padSize / 2;
239                final var leftSize = padSize - rightSize;
240                final var retValue = padding( leftSize, c ) + s.toString() + padding( rightSize, c );
241
242                //---* Done *--------------------------------------------------
243                return retValue;
244            }   //  pad()
245        },
246
247        /**
248         *  The pad characters are added at the beginning of the string
249         *  (prefixing it).
250         */
251        PADDING_LEFT
252        {
253            /**
254             *  {@inheritDoc}
255             */
256            @Override
257            protected final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int padSize, final char c )
258            {
259                return padding( padSize, c ) + s.toString();
260            }   //  pad()
261        },
262
263        /**
264         *  The pad characters are added the end of the string (as a suffix).
265         */
266        PADDING_RIGHT
267        {
268            /**
269             *  {@inheritDoc}
270             */
271            @Override
272            protected final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int padSize, final char c )
273            {
274                return s.toString() + padding( padSize, c );
275            }   //  pad()
276        };
277
278            /*---------*\
279        ====** Methods **======================================================
280            \*---------*/
281        /**
282         *  Pads the given input String.
283         *
284         *  @param  s   The input String.
285         *  @param  padSize The pad size.
286         *  @param  c   The pad character.
287         *  @return The result String.
288         */
289        protected abstract String pad( final CharSequence s, final int padSize, final char c );
290
291        /**
292         *  Returns padding using the specified pad character repeated to the
293         *  given length.<br>
294         *  <br><code>
295         *  Padding.padding(&nbsp;0,&nbsp;'e'&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;""<br>
296         *  Padding.padding(&nbsp;3,&nbsp;'e'&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;"eee"<br>
297         *  Padding.padding(&nbsp;-2,&nbsp;'e'&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;IndexOutOfBoundsException<br>
298         *  </code>
299         *
300         *  @param  repeat  Number of times to repeat {@code padChar}; must be
301         *      0 or greater.
302         *  @param  padChar Character to repeat.
303         *  @return String with repeated {@code padChar} character, or the
304         *      empty String if {@code repeat} is 0.
305         *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {@code repeat} is less than 0.
306         *
307         *  @see StringUtils#repeat(int,int)
308         */
309        private static String padding( final int repeat, final char padChar ) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
310        {
311            if( repeat < 0 ) throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException( format( MSG_PadNegative, repeat ) );
312
313            final var retValue = Character.toString( padChar ).repeat( repeat ).intern();
314
315            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
316            return retValue;
317        }   //  padding()
318    }
319    //  enum Padding
320
321        /*-----------*\
322    ====** Constants **========================================================
323        \*-----------*/
324    /**
325     *  The regular expression for an HTML or XML comment: {@value}.<br>
326     *  <br>This pattern is used by the
327     *  {@link #stripXMLComments(CharSequence)}
328     *  method.
329     *
330     *  @since 0.0.5
331     */
332    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
333    public static final String COMMENTREMOVAL_PATTERN = "<!--.+?-->";
334
335    /**
336     *  The initial buffer size that is used by
337     *  {@link #format(String, Object...)}
338     *  and
339     *  {@link #format(Locale, String, Object...)}
340     *  (per thread): {@value}.
341     *
342     *  @since 0.0.5
343     */
344    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
345    public static final int FORMAT_INITIAL_BUFFERSIZE = 2048;
346
347    /**
348     *  The message text indicating that the given value for the abbreviation
349     *  target length is too short.
350     */
351    private static final String MSG_AbbrTooShort = "The minimum abbreviation width is %d";
352
353    /**
354     *  The message indicating that the give size for padding is negative.
355     */
356    private static final String MSG_PadNegative = "Cannot pad a negative amount: %d";
357
358    /**
359     *  The maximum size to which the padding constant(s) can expand: {@value}.
360     *
361     *  @see #repeat(CharSequence,int) repeat() for String
362     *  @see #repeat(char,int) repeat() for char
363     */
364    @SuppressWarnings( "unused" )
365    private static final int PAD_LIMIT = 8192;
366
367    /**
368     *  The regular expression for an HTML or XML tag: {@value}.<br>
369     *  <br>This pattern is used by the
370     *  {@link #stripTags(CharSequence)}
371     *  method.<br>
372     *  <br>As HTML/XML comments may contain a &quot;greater than&quot; sign
373     *  ('&gt;' or '&amp;gt;'), it is necessary to treat comments
374     *  separately.<br>
375     *  <br>Just as a reminder: several sources recommend using the following
376     *  idiom for embedded JavaScript:<pre><code>  &lt;script&gt;
377     *  &lt;!--
378     *  <i>JavaScript code </i>
379     *  --&gt;
380     *  &lt;/script&gt;</code></pre>
381     *
382     *  @since 0.0.5
383     */
384    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
385    public static final String TAGREMOVAL_PATTERN = "(?:<!--.+?-->)|(?:<[^>]+?>)";
386
387    /**
388     *  The regular expression to identify a variable in a char sequence:
389     *  {@value}.
390     *
391     *  @see #findVariables(CharSequence)
392     *  @see #isValidVariableName(CharSequence)
393     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence,Map...)
394     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence, Function)
395     *
396     *  @since 0.0.5
397     *  @deprecated Use
398     *      {@link Template#VARIABLE_PATTERN}
399     *      instead.
400     */
401    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
402    @Deprecated( since ="0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
403    public static final String VARIABLE_PATTERN = Template.VARIABLE_PATTERN;
404
405    /**
406     *  The template for variables: {@value}. The argument is the name of the
407     *  variable itself; after an optional prefix character, it may not contain
408     *  other characters than the letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower
409     *  case), the digits from '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore
410     *  ('_') and dot ('.').<br>
411     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
412     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
413     *  ('&amp;').<br>
414     *  <br>The prefix character is part of the name.<br>
415     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
416     *  special variable.
417     *
418     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
419     *
420     *  @since 0.0.5
421     *  @deprecated Use
422     *      {@link Template#VARIABLE_TEMPLATE}
423     *      instead.
424     */
425    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
426    @Deprecated( since ="0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
427    public static final String VARIABLE_TEMPLATE = Template.VARIABLE_TEMPLATE;
428

432    /**
433     *  The pattern that is used to identify an HTML or XML comment.
434     *
435     *  @see #stripXMLComments(CharSequence)
436     *  @see #COMMENTREMOVAL_PATTERN
437     */
438    private static final Pattern m_CommentRemovalPattern;
439
440    /**
441     *  The pattern that is used to identify an HTML or XML tag.
442     *
443     *  @see #stripTags(CharSequence)
444     *  @see #TAGREMOVAL_PATTERN
445     */
446    private static final Pattern m_TagRemovalPattern;
447
448    static
449    {
450        //---* The regex patterns *--------------------------------------------
451        try
452        {
453            m_CommentRemovalPattern = compile( COMMENTREMOVAL_PATTERN, DOTALL );
454            m_TagRemovalPattern = compile( TAGREMOVAL_PATTERN, DOTALL );
455        }
456        catch( final PatternSyntaxException e )
457        {
458            throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( "The patterns are constant values that have been tested", e );
459        }
460    }

466     *  No instance of this class is allowed.

468    private StringUtils() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( StringUtils.class ); }

470        /*---------*\
471    ====** Methods **==========================================================
472        \*---------*/
473    /**
474     *  Abbreviates a String using ellipses (Unicode HORIZONTAL ELLIPSIS,
475     *  0x2026). This will turn &quot;<i>Now is the time for all good
476     *  men</i>&quot; into &quot;<i>Now is the time for&hellip;</i>&quot;.<br>
477     *  <br>Specifically:
478     *  <ul>
479     *  <li>If {@code text} is less than {@code maxWidth} characters long,
480     *  return it unchanged.</li>
481     *  <li>Else abbreviate it to <code>(substring( text, 0, max - 1 ) +
482     *  &quot;\u2026&quot; )</code>.</li>
483     *  <li>If {@code maxWidth} is less than 4, throw an
484     *  {@link ValidationException}.</li>
485     *  <li>In no case it will return a String of length greater than
486     *  {@code maxWidth}.</li>
487     *  </ul>
488     *  Some samples:<br>
489     *  <pre><code>
490     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( null, * )      = null
491     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "", 4 )        = ""
492     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abc", 4 ) = "abc"
493     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcd", 4 ) = "abcd;"
494     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 4 ) = "abc&hellip;"
495     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 7 ) = "abcdefg"
496     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 8 ) = "abcdefg"
497     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefg", 3 ) = IllegalArgumentException
498     *  </code></pre>
499     *
500     *  @param  text    The String to abbreviate, can be {@code null}.
501     *  @param  maxWidth    The maximum length of result String, must be at
502     *      least 4.
503     *  @return The abbreviated String, or {@code null} if the input was
504     *      already {@code null}.
505     *  @throws ValidationException The value for {@code maxWidth} was less
506     *      than 4.
507     *
508     *  @since 0.0.5
509     */
510    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
511    public static final String abbreviate( final CharSequence text, final int maxWidth ) throws ValidationException
512    {
513        return abbreviate( text, 0, maxWidth );
514    }   //  abbreviate()
515
516    /**
517     *  Abbreviates a String using ellipses (Unicode HORIZONTAL ELLIPSIS,
518     *  0x2026). This will turn &quot;<i>Now is the time for all good
519     *  men</i>&quot; into &quot;<i>&hellip;is the time
520     *  for&hellip;</i>&quot;.<br>
521     *  <br>Works like
522     *  {@link #abbreviate(CharSequence, int)},
523     *  but allows to specify a &quot;left edge&quot; offset. Note that this
524     *  left edge is not necessarily going to be the leftmost character in the
525     *  result, or the first character following the ellipses, but it will
526     *  appear somewhere in the result. An offset less than 0 will be treated
527     *  as 0, a value greater than {@code maxWidth} will be ignored.<br>
528     *  <br>In no case will it return a String of length greater than
529     *  {@code maxWidth}.<br>
530     *  <br>Some samples:<br>
531     *  <pre>
532     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( null, *, * )                = null
533     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "", 0, 4 )                  = ""
534     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", -1, 10 ) = "abcdefghi&hellip;"
535     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 0, 10 )  = "abcdefghi&hellip;"
536     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 1, 10 )  = "abcdefghi&hellip;"
537     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 4, 10 )  = "&hellip;efghijkl&hellip;"
538     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 5, 10 )  = "&hellip;fghijklm&hellip;"
539     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 6, 10 )  = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
540     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 8, 10 )  = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
541     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 10, 10 ) = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
542     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghijklmno", 12, 10 ) = "&hellip;ghijklmno"
543     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghij", 0, 3 )        = IllegalArgumentException
544     *  StringUtils.abbreviate( "abcdefghij", 5, 6 )        = IllegalArgumentException
545     *  </pre>
546     *
547     *  @param  text    The String to process, can be {@code null}.
548     *  @param  offset  The left edge of the source String; this value will not
549     *      be checked.
550     *  @param  maxWidth    The maximum length of result String, must be at
551     *      least 4.
552     *  @return The abbreviated String, or {@code null} if the input was
553     *      already {@code null}.
554     *  @throws ValidationException The value for {@code maxWidth} was less
555     *      than 4.
556     *
557     *  @since 0.0.5
558     */
559    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
560    public static final String abbreviate( final CharSequence text, final int offset, final int maxWidth ) throws ValidationException
561    {
562        final var ellipsis = Character.toString( CHAR_ELLIPSIS ).intern();
563
564        String retValue = null;
565        if( nonNull( text ) )
566        {
567            if( maxWidth < 4 ) throw new ValidationException( format( MSG_AbbrTooShort, 4 ) );
568
569            final var len = text.length();
570            if( len > maxWidth )
571            {
572                var effectiveOffset = min( offset, len);
573                if( (len - effectiveOffset) < (maxWidth - 1))
574                {
575                    effectiveOffset = len - (maxWidth - 1);
576                }
577                if( effectiveOffset <= 1 )
578                {
579                    retValue = text.subSequence( 0, maxWidth - 1 ) + ellipsis;
580                }
581                else
582                {
583                    if( ((effectiveOffset + maxWidth) - 1) < len )
584                    {
585                        retValue = ellipsis + abbreviate( text.subSequence( effectiveOffset, len ), maxWidth - 1 );
586                    }
587                    else
588                    {
589                        retValue = ellipsis + text.subSequence( len - (maxWidth - 1), len );
590                    }
591                }
592            }
593            else
594            {
595                retValue = text.toString();
596            }
597        }
598
599        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
600        return retValue;
601    }   //  abbreviate()
602
603    /**
604     *  Abbreviates a String using ellipses (Unicode HORIZONTAL ELLIPSIS,
605     *  0x2026) in the middle of the returned text. This will turn &quot;<i>Now
606     *  is the time for all good men</i>&quot; into &quot;<i>Now is &hellip;
607     *  good men</i>&quot;<br>
608     *  <br>Works like
609     *  {@link #abbreviate(CharSequence, int)}.<br>
610     *  <br>In no case will it return a String of length greater than
611     *  {@code maxWidth}.<br>
612     *  <br>Some samples:<br>
613     *  <pre>
614     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle(null, *)      = null
615     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("", 5)        = ""
616     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 5) = "ab&hellip;gh"
617     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 7) = "ab&hellip;gh"
618     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 8) = "abcdefgh"
619     *  StringUtils.abbreviateMiddle("abcdefgh", 4) = IllegalArgumentException
620     *  </pre>
621     *
622     *  @param  str The String to check, may be {@code null}.
623     *  @param  maxWidth    The maximum length of result String, must be at
624     *      least 5.
625     *  @return The abbreviated String, or {@code null} if the input was
626     *      already {@code null}.
627     *  @throws ValidationException The value for {@code maxWidth} was less
628     *      than 5.
629     *
630     *  @since 0.0.5
631     */
632    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
633    public static final String abbreviateMiddle( final CharSequence str, final int maxWidth )
634    {
635        final var ellipsis = Character.toString( CHAR_ELLIPSIS ).intern();
636
637        String retValue = null;
638        if( nonNull( str ) )
639        {
640            if( maxWidth < 5 ) throw new ValidationException( format( MSG_AbbrTooShort, 5 ) );
641
642            final var len = str.length();
643            if( len > maxWidth )
644            {
645                final var suffixLength = (maxWidth - 1) / 2;
646                final var prefixLength = maxWidth - 1 - suffixLength;
647                final var suffixStart = len - suffixLength;
648                retValue = str.subSequence( 0, prefixLength ) + ellipsis + str.subSequence( suffixStart, suffixStart + suffixLength );
649            }
650            else
651            {
652                retValue = str.toString();
653            }
654        }
655
656        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
657        return retValue;
658    }   //  abbreviateMiddle()
659
660    /**
661     *  <p>{@summary Breaks a long string into chunks of the given length.}</p>
662     *  <p>This method returns an instance of
663     *  {@link Stream} that can be easily converted into an array or a
664     *  collection.</p>
665     *  <p>To array:</p>
666     *  <pre><code>breakString( &lt;<i>string</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>chunk</i>&gt; ).toArray( String []::new )</code></pre>
667     *  <p>To collection (here: a
668     *  {@link List}):</p>
669     *  <pre><code>breakString( &lt;<i>string</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>chunk</i>&gt; ).collect( Collectors.toList() )</code></pre>
670     *
671     *  @param  s   The string.
672     *  @param  chunk   The chunk size.
673     *  @return The chunks from the string; the last chunk could be shorter
674     *      than the others.
675     *
676     *  @see Stream#toArray(java.util.function.IntFunction)
677     *  @see Stream#collect(java.util.stream.Collector)
678     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#toList()
679     *
680     *  @since 0.0.5
681     */
682    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
683    public static final Stream<String> breakString( final CharSequence s, final int chunk )
684    {
685        if( chunk < 1 ) throw new ValidationException( format( "Chunk size must not be zero or a negative number: %d", chunk ) );
686
687        final Builder<String> builder = Stream.builder();
688        final var len = requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ).length();
689        var pos = 0;
690        while( (pos + chunk) < len )
691        {
692            builder.add( s.subSequence( pos, pos + chunk ).toString() );
693            pos += chunk;
694        }
695        if( pos < len ) builder.add( s.subSequence( pos, len ).toString() );
696
697        final var retValue = builder.build();
698
699        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
700        return retValue;
701    }   //  breakString()
702
703    /**
704     *  <p>{@summary Breaks a text into lines of the given length, but
705     *  different from
706     *  {@link #breakString(CharSequence, int)},
707     *  it will honour whitespace.}</p>
708     *  <p>This method returns an instance of
709     *  {@link Stream} that can be easily converted into an array, a String, or
710     *  a collection.</p>
711     *  <p>To array:</p>
712     *  <pre><code>breakText( &lt;<i>text</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>len</i>&gt; ).toArray( String []::new )</code></pre>
713     *  <p>To String:</p>
714     *  <pre><code>breakText( &lt;<i>text</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>len</i>&gt; ).collect( Collectors.joining() )</code></pre>
715     *  <p>To collection (here: a
716     *  {@link List}):</p>
717     *  <pre><code>breakText( &lt;<i>text</i>&gt;, &lt;<i>len</i>&gt; ).collect( Collectors.toList() )</code></pre>
718     *
719     *  @param  text    The text.
720     *  @param  lineLength  The length of a line.
721     *  @return The lines; if a word is longer than the given line length, a
722     *      line containing only that word can be longer that the given line
723     *      length.
724     *
725     *  @see Stream#toArray(java.util.function.IntFunction)
726     *  @see Stream#collect(java.util.stream.Collector)
727     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#joining()
728     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#joining(CharSequence)
729     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#joining(CharSequence, CharSequence, CharSequence)
730     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#toList()
731     *
732     *  @since 0.0.5
733     */
734    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
735    public static final Stream<String> breakText( final CharSequence text, final int lineLength )
736    {
737        if( lineLength < 1 ) throw new ValidationException( format( "Line length size must not be zero or a negative number: %d", lineLength ) );
738
739        final Builder<String> builder = Stream.builder();
740
741        for( final var line : splitString( requireNonNullArgument( text, "text" ), '\n' ) )
742        {
743            if( isEmptyOrBlank( line ) )
744            {
745                builder.add( EMPTY_STRING );
746            }
747            else
748            {
749                final var buffer = new StringBuilder();
750                final var chunks = line.split( "\\s" );
751                SplitLoop: for( final var c : chunks )
752                {
753                    if( c.isEmpty() ) continue SplitLoop;
754                    if( (buffer.length() + 1 + c.length()) < lineLength )
755                    {
756                        if( isNotEmpty( buffer) ) buffer.append( ' ' );
757                    }
758                    else
759                    {
760                        if( isNotEmpty( buffer ) )
761                        {
762                            builder.add( buffer.toString() );
763                            buffer.setLength( 0 );
764                        }
765                    }
766                    buffer.append( c );
767                }   //  SplitLoop:
768                if( isNotEmpty( buffer ) ) builder.add( buffer.toString() );
769            }
770        }
771
772        final var retValue = builder.build();
773
774        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
775        return retValue;
776    }   //  breakText()
777
778    /**
779     *  <p>{@summary <i>Capitalises</i> a String, meaning changing the first
780     *  letter to upper case as per
781     *  {@link Character#toUpperCase(char)}.} No other letters are changed.</p>
782     *  <p>A {@code null} input String returns {@code null}.</p>
783     *  <p>Samples:</p>
784     *  <pre><code>  StringUtils.capitalize( null )  == null;
785     *  StringUtils.capitalize( &quot;&quot; )    == &quot;&quot;;
786     *  StringUtils.capitalize( &quot;cat&quot; ) == &quot;Cat&quot;;
787     *  StringUtils.capitalize( &quot;cAt&quot; ) == &quot;CAt&quot;;</code></pre>
788     *  <p>Use this function to create a getter or setter name from the name of
789     *  the attribute.</p>
790     *  <p>This method does not recognise the
791     *  {@linkplain java.util.Locale#getDefault() default locale}.
792     *  This means that &quot;istanbul&quot; will become &quot;Istanbul&quot;
793     *  even for the locale {@code tr_TR} (although &quot;&#x130;stanbul&quot;
794     *  would be correct).</p>
795     *
796     *  @param c    The String to capitalise, can be {@code null}.
797     *  @return The capitalised String, or {@code null} if the argument
798     *      was already {@code null}.
799     *
800     *  @see #decapitalize(CharSequence)
801     *
802     *  @since 0.0.5
803     */
804    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
805    public static final String capitalize( final CharSequence c )
806    {
807        String retValue = null;
808        if( nonNull( c ) )
809        {
810            final var s = c.toString();
811            if( s.isEmpty() )
812            {
813                retValue = s;
814            }
815            else
816            {
817                retValue = (toUpperCase( s.charAt( 0 ) ) + s.substring( 1 )).intern();
818            }
819        }
820
821        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
822        return retValue;
823    }   //  capitalize()
824
825    /**
826     *  Tests if the given text is not {@code null}, not empty and not
827     *  longer than the given maximum length.
828     *
829     *  @param  name    The name that should appear in the exception if one
830     *      will be thrown.
831     *  @param  text    The text to check.
832     *  @param  maxLength   The maximum length.
833     *  @return Always the contents of <code>text</code> as a String; if the
834     *      argument fails any of the tests, an
835     *      {@link IllegalArgumentException}
836     *      or an exception derived from that will be thrown.
837     *  @throws CharSequenceTooLongException    {@code text} is longer than
838     *      {@code maxLength}.
839     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException {@code text} is the empty String.
840     *  @throws NullArgumentException   Either {@code name} or {@code text} is
841     *      {@code null}.
842     *
843     *  @deprecated Replaced by
844     *      {@link #checkTextLen(String, CharSequence, int)}
845     */
846    @API( status = DEPRECATED )
847    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true )
848    public static final String checkText( final String name, final CharSequence text, final int maxLength ) throws CharSequenceTooLongException, EmptyArgumentException, NullArgumentException
849    {
850        return checkTextLen( name, text, maxLength );
851    }   //  checkText()

853    /**
854     *  Tests if the given text is not {@code null}, not empty and not
855     *  longer than the given maximum length. Use this to check whether a
856     *  String that is provided as an argument to a method is longer than
857     *  expected.
858     *
859     *  @param  name    The name that should appear in the exception if one
860     *      will be thrown. Usually this is the name of the argument to
861     *      validate.
862     *  @param  text    The text to check.
863     *  @param  maxLength   The maximum length.
864     *  @return Always the contents of <code>text</code> as a String; if the
865     *      argument fails any of the tests, an
866     *      {@link IllegalArgumentException}
867     *      or an exception derived from that will be thrown.
868     *  @throws CharSequenceTooLongException    {@code text} is longer than
869     *      {@code maxLength}.
870     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException Either {@code name} or {@code text} is
871     *      the empty String.
872     *  @throws NullArgumentException   Either {@code name} or {@code text} is
873     *      {@code null}.
874     *
875     *  @since 0.0.5
876     */
877    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
878    public static final String checkTextLen( final String name, final CharSequence text, final int maxLength ) throws CharSequenceTooLongException, EmptyArgumentException, NullArgumentException
879    {
880        if( requireNotEmptyArgument( text, requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" ) ).length() > maxLength )
881        {
882            throw new CharSequenceTooLongException( name, maxLength );
883        }
884
885        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
886        return text.toString();
887    }   //  checkTextLen()

889    /**
890     *  Tests if the given text is not longer than the given maximum length;
891     *  different from
892     *  {@link #checkTextLen(String, CharSequence, int)},
893     *  it may be {@code null} or empty.
894     *
895     *  @param  name    The name that should appear in the exception if one
896     *      will be thrown.
897     *  @param  text    The text to check; may be {@code null}.
898     *  @param  maxLength   The maximum length.
899     *  @return Always the contents of {@code text} as a String, {@code null}
900     *      if {@code text} was {@code null}; if the argument fails any of the
901     *      tests, an
902     *      {@link IllegalArgumentException}
903     *      or an exception derived from that will be thrown.
904     *  @throws CharSequenceTooLongException    {@code text} is longer than
905     *      {@code maxLength}.
906     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is empty.
907     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name} is {@code null}.
908     *
909     *  @since 0.0.5
910     */
911    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
912    public static final String checkTextLenNull( final String name, final CharSequence text, final int maxLength ) throws CharSequenceTooLongException
913    {
914        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
915
916        String retValue = null;
917        if( nonNull( text ) )
918        {
919            if( text.length() > maxLength )
920            {
921                throw new CharSequenceTooLongException( name, maxLength );
922            }
923            retValue = text.toString();
924        }
925
926        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
927        return retValue;
928    }   //  checkTextLenNull()

930    /**
931     *  Tests if the given text is not longer than the given maximum length;
932     *  it may be {@code null}.
933     *
934     *  @param  name    The name that should appear in the exception if one
935     *      will be thrown.
936     *  @param  text    The text to check; may be {@code null}.
937     *  @param  maxLength   The maximum length.
938     *  @return Always the contents of {@code text} as a String,
939     *      {@code null} if {@code text} was {@code null}; if the
940     *      argument fails any of the tests, an
941     *      {@link IllegalArgumentException}
942     *      or an exception derived from that will be thrown.
943     *  @throws CharSequenceTooLongException    {@code text} is longer than
944     *      {@code maxLength}.
945     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name} is {@code null}.
946     *
947     *  @deprecated Replaced by
948     *      {@link #checkTextLenNull(String, CharSequence, int)}.
949     */
950    @API( status = DEPRECATED )
951    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true )
952    public static final String checkTextNull( final String name, final CharSequence text, final int maxLength )
953    {
954        return checkTextLenNull( name, text, maxLength );
955    }   //  checkTextNull()

957    /**
958     *  Changes the first letter of the given String tolower case as per
959     *  {@link Character#toLowerCase(char)}.
960     *  No other letters are changed. A {@code null} input String returns
961     *  {@code null}.<br>
962     *  <br>Samples:<pre><code>  StringUtils.decapitalize( null ) = null;
963     *  StringUtils.decapitalize(&quot;&quot;)     = &quot;&quot;;
964     *  StringUtils.decapitalize(&quot;Cat&quot;)  = &quot;cat&quot;;
965     *  StringUtils.decapitalize(&quot;CAT&quot;)  = &quot;cAT&quot;;</code></pre>
966     *  <br>Basically, this is the complementary method to
967     *  {@link #capitalize(CharSequence)}.
968     *  Use this method to normalise the name of bean attributes.
969     *
970     *  @param  s   The String to <i>decapitalise</i>, may be {@code null}.
971     *  @return The <i>decapitalised</i> String, {@code null} if the argument
972     *      was {@code null}.
973     *  @see #capitalize(CharSequence)
974     *
975     *  @since 0.0.5
976     */
977    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
978    public static final String decapitalize( final CharSequence s )
979    {
980        String retValue = null;
981
982        if( nonNull( s ) )
983        {
984            retValue = EMPTY_STRING;
985            if( isNotEmpty( s ) )
986            {
987                final var str = s.toString();
988                retValue = (toLowerCase( str.charAt( 0 ) ) + str.substring( 1 )).intern();
989            }
990        }
991
992        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
993        return retValue;
994    }   //  decapitalize()
995
996    /**
997     *  Escapes the non-ASCII and special characters in a {@code String} so
998     *  that the result can be used in the context of HTML. Wherever possible,
999     *  the method will return the respective HTML&nbsp;5 entity; only when
1000     *  there is no matching entity, it will use the Unicode escape. So if you
1001     *  call the method with the argument &quot;<i>S&uuml;&szlig;e</i>&quot;,
1002     *  it will return &quot;<code>S&amp;uuml;&amp;szlig;e</code>&quot;. If the
1003     *  input will be, for example, a Chinese text like this:
1004     *  &quot;<i>çä½</i>&quot; (means "Ball"), you may get back
1005     *  something like this: &quot;<code>&amp;#x7403;&amp;#x4F53;</code>&quot;,
1006     *  as there are no entities defined for (all) Chinese letters.<br>
1007     *  <br>The method supports all known HTML 5.0 entities, including funky
1008     *  accents. But it will not escape several commonly used characters like
1009     *  the full stop ('.'), the comma (','), the colon (':'), or the
1010     *  semi-colon (';'), although they will be handled properly by
1011     *  {@link #unescapeHTML(CharSequence)}.<br>
1012     *  <br>Note that the commonly used apostrophe escape character
1013     *  (&amp;apos;) that was not a legal entity for HTML before HTML&nbsp; is
1014     *  now supported.
1015     *
1016     *  @param  str The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
1017     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}, or {@code null} if the
1018     *      argument was already {@code null}.
1019     *
1020     *  @see #unescapeHTML(CharSequence)
1021     *  @see <a href="http://hotwired.lycos.com/webmonkey/reference/special_characters/">ISO Entities</a>
1022     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html32#latin1">HTML 3.2 Character Entities for ISO Latin-1</a>
1023     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/sgml/entities.html">HTML 4.0 Character entity references</a>
1024     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#h-5.3">HTML 4.01 Character References</a>
1025     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#code-position">HTML 4.01 Code positions</a>
1026     *
1027     *  @since 0.0.5
1028     */
1029    /*
1030     *  For some unknown reasons, JavaDoc will not accept the entities &#x7403;
1031     *  and &#x4F53; (for 'ç' and 'ä½'), therefore it was required to add the
1032     *  Chinese character directly into the comment above.
1033     */
1034    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1035    public static final String escapeHTML( final CharSequence str )
1036    {
1037        final var retValue = nonNull( str ) ? HTML50.escape( str ) : null;
1038
1039        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1040        return retValue;
1041    }   //  escapeHTML()
1042
1043    /**
1044     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using HTML entities and
1045     *  writes them to an
1046     *  {@link Appendable}.
1047     *  For details, refer to
1048     *  {@link #escapeHTML(CharSequence)}.
1049     *
1050     *  @param  appendable  The appendable object receiving the escaped string.
1051     *  @param  str  The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
1052     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
1053     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
1054     *      from calls to the
1055     *      {@link Appendable#append(char)}
1056     *      method.
1057     *
1058     *  @see #escapeHTML(CharSequence)
1059     *  @see #unescapeHTML(CharSequence)
1060     *  @see <a href="http://hotwired.lycos.com/webmonkey/reference/special_characters/">ISO Entities</a>
1061     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html32#latin1">HTML 3.2 Character Entities for ISO Latin-1</a>
1062     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/sgml/entities.html">HTML 4.0 Character entity references</a>
1063     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#h-5.3">HTML 4.01 Character References</a>
1064     *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#code-position">HTML 4.01 Code positions</a>
1065     *
1066     *  @since 0.0.5
1067     */
1068    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1069    public static final void escapeHTML( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence str ) throws IOException
1070    {
1071        requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" );
1072
1073        if( nonNull( str ) ) HTML50.escape( appendable, str );
1074    }   //  escapeHTML()
1075
1076    /**
1077     *  Formats the given {@code String} for the output into JSONText. This
1078     *  means that the input sequence will be surrounded by double quotes, and
1079     *  backslash sequences are put into all the right places.<br>
1080     *  <br>&lt; and &gt; will be inserted as their Unicode values, allowing
1081     *  JSON text to be delivered in HTML.<br>
1082     *  <br>In JSON text, a string cannot contain a control character or an
1083     *  unescaped quote or backslash, so these are translated to Unicode
1084     *  escapes also.
1085     *
1086     *  @param  str The string to escape to the JSON format; it may be empty,
1087     *      but not {@code null}.
1088     *  @return A string correctly formatted for insertion in a JSON text.
1089     *
1090     *  @since 0.0.5
1091     */
1092    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1093    public static final String escapeJSON( final CharSequence str )
1094    {
1095        var retValue = "\"\""; // The JSON empty string.
1096        final var len = requireNonNullArgument( str, "str" ).length();
1097        if( len > 0 )
1098        {
1099            final var buffer = new StringBuilder( len * 2 ).append( '"' );
1100            char c;
1101            for( var i = 0; i < len; ++i )
1102            {
1103                c = str.charAt( i );
1104                switch( c )
1105                {
1106                    case '\\':
1107                    case '"':
1108                    case '<':
1109                    case '>':
1110                    case '&':
1111                        buffer.append( escapeCharacter( c ) );
1112                        break;
1113
1114                    case '\b':
1115                        buffer.append( "\\b" );
1116                        break;
1117
1118                    case '\t':
1119                        buffer.append( "\\t" );
1120                        break;
1121
1122                    case '\n':
1123                        buffer.append( "\\n" );
1124                        break;
1125
1126                    case '\f':
1127                        buffer.append( "\\f" );
1128                        break;
1129
1130                    case '\r':
1131                        buffer.append( "\\r" );
1132                        break;
1133
1134                    default:
1135                        //noinspection OverlyComplexBooleanExpression
1136                        if( (c < ' ')
1137                            || ((c >= '\u0080') && (c < '\u00a0'))
1138                            || ((c >= '\u2000') && (c < '\u2100')) )
1139                        {
1140                            buffer.append( escapeCharacter( c ) );
1141                        }
1142                        else
1143                        {
1144                            buffer.append( c );
1145                        }
1146                        break;
1147                }
1148            }
1149            buffer.append( '"' );
1150            retValue = buffer.toString();
1151        }
1152
1153        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1154        return retValue;
1155    }   //  escapeJSON()
1156
1157    /**
1158     *  Escapes the given character using Regex escapes and writes them to a
1159     *  {@link Appendable}.
1160     *
1161     *  @param  appendable  The appendable receiving the escaped string.
1162     *  @param  c   The character to escape.
1163     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
1164     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
1165     *      from calls to the
1166     *      {@link Appendable#append(CharSequence)}
1167     *      method.
1168     *
1169     *  @since 0.0.5
1170     */
1171    @SuppressWarnings( "SwitchStatementWithTooManyBranches" )
1172    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1173    public static final void escapeRegex( final Appendable appendable, final char c ) throws IOException
1174    {
1175        requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" );
1176
1177        TestSwitch: switch( c )
1178        {
1179            case '\\' -> appendable.append( "\\" );
1180            case '[', ']', '{', '}', '(', ')', '^', '$', '&', '*', '.', '+', '|', '?' -> appendable.append( "\\" ).append( c );
1181            case '\t' -> appendable.append( "\\t" );
1182            case '\n' -> appendable.append( "\\n" );
1183            case '\r' -> appendable.append( "\\r" );
1184            case '\f' -> appendable.append( "\\f" );
1185            case '\u0007' -> appendable.append( "\\a" );
1186            case '\u001B' -> appendable.append( "\\e" ); // ESC
1187            default -> appendable.append( c );
1188        }   //  TestSwitch:
1189    }   //  escapeRegex()
1190
1191    /**
1192     *  Escapes the given character using Regex escapes.
1193     *
1194     *  @param  c   The character to escape.
1195     *  @return A {@code String} with the escaped character.
1196     *
1197     *  @since 0.0.5
1198     */
1199    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1200    public static final String escapeRegex( final char c )
1201    {
1202        final var retValue = new StringBuilder();
1203        try
1204        {
1205            escapeRegex( retValue, c );
1206        }
1207        catch( final IOException e )
1208        {
1209            /*
1210             * We append to a StringBuilder, and StringBuilder.append() does
1211             * not define an IOException.
1212             */
1213            throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( e );
1214        }
1215
1216        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1217        return retValue.toString();
1218    }   //  escapeRegex()
1219
1220    /**
1221     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using Regex escapes.
1222     *
1223     *  @param  str The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
1224     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}, or {@code null} if the argument
1225     *      was already {@code null}.
1226     *
1227     *  @since 0.0.5
1228     */
1229    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1230    public static final String escapeRegex( final CharSequence str )
1231    {
1232        String retValue = null;
1233        if( nonNull( str ) )
1234        {
1235            final var len = str.length();
1236            if( len > 0 )
1237            {
1238                final var buffer = new StringBuilder( (len * 12) / 10 );
1239                try
1240                {
1241                    escapeRegex( buffer, str );
1242                }
1243                catch( final IOException e )
1244                {
1245                    /*
1246                     * We append to a StringBuilder, and StringBuilder.append() does
1247                     * not define an IOException.
1248                     */
1249                    throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( e );
1250                }
1251                retValue = buffer.toString();
1252            }
1253            else
1254            {
1255                retValue = EMPTY_STRING;
1256            }
1257        }
1258
1259        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1260        return retValue;
1261    }   //  escapeRegex()
1262
1263    /**
1264     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using Regex escapes and
1265     *  writes them to a
1266     *  {@link Appendable}.
1267     *
1268     *  @param  appendable  The appendable receiving the escaped string.
1269     *  @param  str  The {@code String} to escape. If {@code null} or the empty
1270     *      String, nothing will be put to the appendable.
1271     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
1272     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
1273     *      from calls to the
1274     *      {@link Appendable#append(CharSequence)}
1275     *      method.
1276     *
1277     *  @since 0.0.5
1278     */
1279    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1280    public static final void escapeRegex( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence str ) throws IOException
1281    {
1282        requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" );
1283
1284        if( isNotEmpty( str ) )
1285        {
1286            ScanLoop: for( var i = 0; i < str.length(); ++i )
1287            {
1288                escapeRegex( appendable, str.charAt( i ) );
1289            }   //  ScanLoop:
1290        }
1291    }   //  escapeRegex()
1292
1293    /**
1294     *  Returns the Unicode escape sequence for the given character. This will
1295     *  return &quot;&#92;u0075&quot; for the letter 'u', and
1296     *  &quot;&#92;u003c&quot; for the smaller-than sign '&lt;'.<br>
1297     *  <br>This method should be used only for characters that are not
1298     *  surrogates; for general use, the implementation that takes a code point
1299     *  is preferred.
1300     *
1301     *  @param  c   The character.
1302     *  @return The escape sequence.
1303     *
1304     *  @see #escapeUnicode(int)
1305     *
1306     *  @since 0.0.5
1307     *  @deprecated Use
1308     *      {@link CharSetUtils#escapeCharacter(char)}
1309     *      instead.
1310     */
1311    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
1312    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
1313    public static final String escapeUnicode( final char c ) { return escapeCharacter( c ); }
1314
1315    /**
1316     *  Returns the Unicode escape sequence for the given code point. This will
1317     *  return &quot;&#92;u0075&quot; for the letter 'u', and
1318     *  &quot;&#92;u003c&quot; for the smaller-than sign '&lt;'.<br>
1319     *  <br>This method takes only a single code point; to translate a whole
1320     *  String, this code sequence can be used:<pre><code>  &hellip;
1321     *  String result = input.codePoints()
1322     *      .mapToObj( codePoint -&gt; escapeUnicode( codePoint ) )
1323     *      .collect( Collectors.joining() );
1324     *  &hellip;</code></pre>
1325     *  This will escape <i>all</i> characters in the String. If only a subset
1326     *  needs to be escaped, the mapping function in
1327     *  {@link java.util.stream.IntStream#mapToObj(java.util.function.IntFunction) mapToObj()}
1328     *  can be adjusted accordingly. Something like that is implemented with
1329     *  the method
1330     *  {@link #toUnicode(CharSequence)}.
1331     *
1332     *  @param  codePoint   The character.
1333     *  @return The escape sequence.
1334     *
1335     *  @see String#codePoints()
1336     *  @see java.util.stream.IntStream#mapToObj(java.util.function.IntFunction)
1337     *  @see java.util.stream.Stream#collect(java.util.stream.Collector)
1338     *  @see java.util.stream.Collectors#joining()
1339     *
1340     *  @since 0.0.5
1341     *  @deprecated Use
1342     *      {@link CharSetUtils#escapeCharacter(int)}
1343     *      instead.
1344     */
1345    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
1346    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
1347    public static final String escapeUnicode( final int codePoint ) { return escapeCharacter( codePoint ); }
1348
1349    /**
1350     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using XML entities.<br>
1351     *  <br>For example:<br>
1352     *  <br>{@code "bread" & "butter"}<br>
1353     *  <br>becomes:<br>
1354     *  <br><code>&amp;quot;bread&amp;quot; &amp;amp;
1355     *  &amp;quot;butter&amp;quot;</code>.
1356     *
1357     *  @param  str The {@code String} to escape, may be null.
1358     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}, or {@code null} if the
1359     *      argument was already {@code null}.
1360     *
1361     *  @see #unescapeXML(CharSequence)
1362     */
1363    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1364    public static final String escapeXML( final CharSequence str )
1365    {
1366        final var retValue = nonNull( str ) ? XML.escape( str ) : null;
1367
1368        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1369        return retValue;
1370    }   //  escapeXML()
1371
1372    /**
1373     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using XML entities and
1374     *  writes them to an
1375     *  {@link Appendable}.<br>
1376     *  <br>For example:<br>
1377     *  <br>{@code "bread" & "butter"}<br>
1378     *  <br>becomes:<br>
1379     *  <br><code>&amp;quot;bread&amp;quot; &amp;amp;
1380     *  &amp;quot;butter&amp;quot;</code>.
1381     *
1382     *  @param  appendable  The appendable object receiving the escaped string.
1383     *  @param  str  The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
1384     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
1385     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
1386     *      from calls to the
1387     *      {@link Appendable#append(char)}
1388     *      method.
1389     *
1390     *  @see #escapeXML(CharSequence)
1391     *  @see #unescapeXML(CharSequence)
1392     *
1393     *  @since 0.0.5
1394     */
1395    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1396    public static final void escapeXML( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence str ) throws IOException
1397    {
1398        requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" );
1399
1400        if( nonNull( str ) ) XML.escape( appendable, str );
1401    }   //  escapeXML()

1403    /**
1404     *  Collects all the variables of the form
1405     *  <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> in the given String.<br>
1406     *  <br>If there are not any variables in the given String, an empty
1407     *  {@link Collection}
1408     *  will be returned.<br>
1409     *  <br>A valid variable name may not contain any other characters than the
1410     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
1411     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
1412     *  after an optional prefix character.<br>
1413     *  <br>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
1414     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
1415     *  ('&amp;').<br>
1416     *  <br>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
1417     *  special variable.
1418     *
1419     *  @param  text    The text with the variables; may be {@code null}.
1420     *  @return A {@code Collection} with the variable (names).
1421     *
1422     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
1423     *
1424     *  @since 0.0.5
1425     *  @deprecated Use
1426     *      {@link Template#findVariables(CharSequence)}
1427     *      instead.
1428     */
1429    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
1430    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
1431    public static final Collection<String> findVariables( final CharSequence text )
1432    {
1433        return Template.findVariables( text );
1434    }   //  findVariables()
1435
1436    /**
1437     *  Returns a formatted String using the specified format String and
1438     *  arguments.<br>
1439     *  <br>The implementation uses internally the
1440     *  {@link Locale}
1441     *  that is returned by
1442     *  {@link java.util.Locale#getDefault() Locale.getDefault()}.<br>
1443     *  <br>This method is meant as a replacement for the method
1444     *  {@link java.lang.String#format(String, Object...)};
1445     *  that implementation always uses a new instance of
1446     *  {@link Formatter}
1447     *  for each invocation. The implementation here uses a cached instance
1448     *  instead, and as {@code Formatter} is not inherently thread-safe, this
1449     *  cached instance is created and stored per thread, therefore no
1450     *  synchronisation is needed.<br>
1451     *  <br>This implementation is about as twice as fast as
1452     *  {@code java.lang.String.format()}.
1453     *
1454     *  @param  format  A format String with the syntax as described for the
1455     *      {@link Formatter}
1456     *      class.
1457     *  @param  args    The arguments referenced by the format specifiers in
1458     *      the {@code format} String. If there are more arguments than format
1459     *      specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The number of
1460     *      arguments is variable and may be zero. The maximum number of
1461     *      arguments is limited by the maximum dimension of a Java array as
1462     *      defined by <cite>The Java&trade; Virtual Machine
1463     *      Specification</cite>. The behaviour on a {@code null} argument
1464     *      depends on the conversion.
1465     *  @throws IllegalFormatException A format string contains an illegal
1466     *      syntax, a format specifier that is incompatible with the given
1467     *      arguments, insufficient arguments given the format string, or other
1468     *      illegal conditions occurred. For specification of all possible
1469     *      formatting errors, see the &quot;Details&quot; section of the
1470     *      {@code Formatter} class specification.
1471     *  @return A formatted String.
1472     *
1473     *  @see  java.util.Formatter
1474     *
1475     *  @since 0.0.5
1476     */
1477    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1478    public static final String format( final String format, final Object... args ) throws IllegalFormatException
1479    {
1480        return SharedFormatter.format( format, args );
1481    }   //  format()
1482
1483    /**
1484     *  Returns a formatted String using the specified
1485     *  {@link Locale},
1486     *  format String, and arguments.<br>
1487     *  <br>This method is meant as a replacement for the method
1488     *  {@link java.lang.String#format(String, Object...)};
1489     *  that implementation always uses a new instance of
1490     *  {@link Formatter}
1491     *  for each invocation. The implementation here uses a cached instance
1492     *  instead, and as {@code Formatter} is not inherently thread-safe, this
1493     *  cached instance is created and stored per thread, therefore no
1494     *  synchronisation is needed.<br>
1495     *  <br>The performance gain for this implementation is not that impressive
1496     *  when compared with that of
1497     *  {@link #format(String, Object...)},
1498     *  but still in the 10% range.
1499     *  {@code java.lang.String.format()}.
1500     *
1501     *  @param  locale  The
1502     *      {@link Locale}
1503     *      that will be applied during formatting. If {@code locale} is
1504     *      {@code null} then no localisation is applied.
1505     *  @param  format  A format String with the syntax as described for the
1506     *      {@link Formatter}
1507     *      class.
1508     *  @param  args    The arguments referenced by the format specifiers in
1509     *      the {@code format} String. If there are more arguments than format
1510     *      specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The number of
1511     *      arguments is variable and may be zero. The maximum number of
1512     *      arguments is limited by the maximum dimension of a Java array as
1513     *      defined by <cite>The Java&trade; Virtual Machine
1514     *      Specification</cite>. The behaviour on a {@code null} argument
1515     *      depends on the conversion.
1516     *  @throws IllegalFormatException A format string contains an illegal
1517     *      syntax, a format specifier that is incompatible with the given
1518     *      arguments, insufficient arguments given the format string, or other
1519     *      illegal conditions occurred. For specification of all possible
1520     *      formatting errors, see the &quot;Details&quot; section of the
1521     *      {@code Formatter} class specification.
1522     *  @return A formatted String.
1523     *
1524     *  @see  java.util.Formatter
1525     *
1526     *  @since 0.0.5
1527     */
1528    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1529    public static final String format( final Locale locale, final String format, final Object... args ) throws IllegalFormatException
1530    {
1531        return SharedFormatter.format( locale, format, args );
1532    }   //  format()
1533

1719    /**
1720     *  Combines the given
1721     *  {@link Stream}
1722     *  of Strings to a single string, with the given separator.
1723     *
1724     *  @param  s   The input sequence.
1725     *  @param  separator   The separator; may be empty, but not {@code null}.
1726     *  @return The combined String. If the input sequence stream is empty,
1727     *      the empty String will be returned.
1728     *
1729     *  @deprecated This method is obsolete; the same effect can be achieved
1730     *      easily by calling
1731     *      {@link Stream#collect(java.util.stream.Collector)}
1732     *      on the stream, with the collector
1733     *      {@link java.util.stream.Collectors#joining(CharSequence) joining()}
1734     *      as its argument.
1735     */
1736    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.4" )
1737    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true, since = "Java 8" )
1738    public static final String joinString( final Stream<? extends CharSequence> s, final CharSequence separator )
1739    {
1740        final var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ).collect( joining( separator ) );
1741
1742        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1743        return retValue;
1744    }   //  joinString()
1745
1746    /**
1747     *  Combines the given String array to a single string, with the given
1748     *  separator.
1749     *
1750     *  @param  s   The input sequence.
1751     *  @param  separator   The separator.
1752     *  @return The combined String. If the input sequence array is empty, the
1753     *      empty String will be returned.
1754     *
1755     *  @deprecated This method is obsolete; the same effect can be achieved
1756     *      easily by calling
1757     *      {@link String#join(CharSequence, CharSequence...)}.
1758     */
1759    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true, since = "Java 8" )
1760    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.4" )
1761    public static final String joinString( final CharSequence [] s, final char separator )
1762    {
1763        final var retValue = join( Character.toString( separator), requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ) );
1764
1765        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1766        return retValue;
1767    }   //  joinString()

1775     *  @return The combined String. If the input sequence collection is empty, the

1788        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1789        return retValue;

1792    /**
1793     *  Determines the maximum length over all strings provided in the given
1794     *  collection.<br>
1795     *  <br>For an array, this method can be called like this:<pre><code>  String [] a = {"1", "2", "3"};
1796     *  maxContentLength( Arrays.asList( a ) );</code></pre>
1797     *
1798     *  @param  list    The strings.
1799     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
1800     *      in the list are {@code null}.
1801     *
1802     *  @deprecated Use
1803     *      {@link #maxContentLength(CharSequence[])},
1804     *      {@link #maxContentLength(Collection)},
1805     *      or
1806     *      {@link #maxContentLength(Stream)}
1807     *      instead.
1808     */
1809    @Deprecated( forRemoval = true )
1810    @API( status = DEPRECATED )
1811    public static final int maxContentLength( final Iterable<? extends CharSequence> list )
1812    {
1813        var retValue = Integer.MIN_VALUE;
1814        int len;
1815        for( final var cs : requireNonNullArgument( list, "list" ) )
1816        {
1817            len = nonNull( cs ) ? cs.length() : -1;
1818            if( len > retValue )
1819            {
1820                retValue = len;
1821            }
1822        }
1823
1824        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1825        return retValue;
1826    }   //  maxContentLength()
1827
1828    /**
1829     *  Determines the maximum length over all Strings provided in the given
1830     *  {@link Stream}.
1831     *
1832     *  @param  stream  The strings.
1833     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
1834     *      in the given {@code stream} are {@code null}, and
1835     *      {@link Integer#MIN_VALUE}
1836     *      if the given {@code stream} is empty.
1837     *
1838     *  @since 0.0.5
1839     */
1840    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1841    public static final int maxContentLength( final Stream<? extends CharSequence> stream )
1842    {
1843        final var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( stream, "stream" )
1844            .mapToInt( s -> nonNull( s ) ? s.length() : -1 )
1845            .max()
1846            .orElse( Integer.MIN_VALUE );
1847
1848        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1849        return retValue;
1850    }   //  maxContentLength()
1851
1852    /**
1853     *  Determines the maximum length over all strings provided in the given
1854     *  {@link Collection}.
1855     *
1856     *  @param  list    The strings.
1857     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
1858     *      in the given {@code list} are {@code null}, and
1859     *      {@link Integer#MIN_VALUE}
1860     *      if the given {@code list} is empty.
1861     *
1862     *  @since 0.0.5
1863     */
1864    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1865    public static final int maxContentLength( final Collection<? extends CharSequence> list )
1866    {
1867        final var retValue = maxContentLength( requireNonNullArgument( list, "list" ).stream() );
1868
1869        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1870        return retValue;
1871    }   //  maxContentLength()
1872
1873    /**
1874     *  Determines the maximum length over all strings provided in the given
1875     *  array.
1876     *
1877     *  @param  a   The strings.
1878     *  @return The length of the longest string in the list; -1 if all values
1879     *      in the array are {@code null}, and
1880     *      {@link Integer#MIN_VALUE}
1881     *      if the given array has zero length.
1882     *
1883     *  @since 0.0.5
1884     */
1885    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1886    public static final int maxContentLength( final CharSequence... a )
1887    {
1888        final var retValue = maxContentLength( Arrays.stream( requireNonNullArgument( a, "a" ) ) );
1889
1890        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1891        return retValue;
1892    }   //  maxContentLength()

1894    /**
1895     *  Brings the given string to the given length and uses the provided
1896     *  padding character to fill up the string.
1897     *
1898     *  @param  s   The string to format.
1899     *  @param  length  The desired length; if 0 or less, the given string is
1900     *      returned, regardless of {@code clip}.
1901     *  @param  c   The pad character.
1902     *  @param  mode    The
1903     *      {@linkplain StringUtils.Padding pad mode}.
1904     *  @param  clip    {@code true} if the input string {@code s} should
1905     *      be cut in case it is longer than {@code length}, {@code false}
1906     *      if it has to be returned unchanged .
1907     *  @return The re-formatted string.
1908     *
1909     *  @since 0.0.5
1910     */
1911    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1912    public static final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int length, final char c, final Padding mode, final boolean clip )
1913    {
1914        return pad( s, length, c, mode, clip ? CLIPPING_CUT : CLIPPING_NONE );
1915    }   //  pad()
1916
1917    /**
1918     *  Brings the given string to the given length and uses the provided
1919     *  padding character to fill up the string.
1920     *
1921     *  @param  s   The string to format.
1922     *  @param  length  The desired length; if 0 or less, the given string is
1923     *      returned, regardless of {@code clip}.
1924     *  @param  c   The pad character.
1925     *  @param  mode    The
1926     *      {@linkplain StringUtils.Padding pad mode}.
1927     *  @param  clip    The
1928     *      {@linkplain StringUtils.Clipping clipping mode}.
1929     *  @return The re-formatted string.
1930     *
1931     *  @since 0.0.5
1932     */
1933    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1934    public static final String pad( final CharSequence s, final int length, final char c, final Padding mode, final Clipping clip )
1935    {
1936        //noinspection OverlyComplexBooleanExpression
1937        if( ((requireNonNullArgument( clip, "clip" ) == CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE) && (length < 4)) || ((clip == CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE) && (length < 5)) )
1938        {
1939            throw new ValidationException( format( "Length %d is too short for clipping mode %s", length, clip.toString() ) );
1940        }
1941        requireNonNullArgument( mode, "mode" );
1942
1943        final String retValue;
1944        final var currentLength = requireNonNullArgument( s, "s" ).length();
1945
1946        if( (length > 0) && (length != currentLength) )
1947        {
1948            if( currentLength > length )
1949            {
1950                retValue = clip.clip( s, length );
1951            }
1952            else
1953            {
1954                final var padSize = length - currentLength;
1955                retValue = mode.pad( s, padSize, c );
1956            }
1957        }
1958        else
1959        {
1960            retValue = s.toString();
1961        }
1962
1963        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1964        return retValue;
1965    }   //  pad()
1966
1967    /**
1968     *  Fills up the given string to the given length by adding blanks on both
1969     *  sides; will abbreviate the string if it is longer than the given
1970     *  length. The minimum length is 5.<br>
1971     *  <br>This is a shortcut to a call to
1972     *  {@link #pad(CharSequence,int,char,Padding,Clipping) pad( s, length, ' ', PADDING_CENTER, CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE ) }.
1973     *
1974     *  @param  s   The string to format.
1975     *  @param  length  The desired length; minimum value is 5.
1976     *  @return The re-formatted string.
1977     *
1978     *  @see Padding#PADDING_CENTER
1979     *  @see Clipping#CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE
1980     *
1981     *  @since 0.0.5
1982     */
1983    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1984    public static final String padCenter( final CharSequence s, final int length ) { return pad( s, length, ' ', PADDING_CENTER, CLIPPING_ABBREVIATE_MIDDLE ); }
1985

2024    /**
2025     *  Repeats the given char {@code repeat} to form a new String. The table
2026     *  below shows the various  result for some argument combinations.<br>
2027     *  <br><code>
2028     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;'a',&nbsp;0&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;""<br>
2029     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;'a',&nbsp;3&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;"aaa"<br>
2030     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;'a',&nbsp;-2&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;""<br>
2031     *  </code>
2032     *
2033     *  @param  c   The character to repeat.
2034     *  @param  repeat  The number of times to repeat {@code c}; a negative
2035     *      value will be treated as zero.
2036     *  @return A new String consisting of the given character repeated
2037     *      {@code repeat} times, or the empty String if {@code repeat} was 0
2038     *      or negative.
2039     *
2040     *  @see String#repeat(int)
2041     *
2042     *  @since 0.0.5
2043     */
2044    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
2045    public static final String repeat( final char c, final int repeat )
2046    {
2047        final var retValue = (repeat > 0 ? Character.toString( c ).repeat( repeat ) : EMPTY_STRING).intern();
2048
2049        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2050        return retValue;
2051    }   //  repeat()

2053    /**
2054     *  Repeats the given char {@code repeat}, identified by its code point, to
2055     *  form a new String. The
2056     *  table below shows the various  result for some argument
2057     *  combinations.<br>
2058     *  <br><code>
2059     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;'a',&nbsp;0&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;""<br>
2060     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;'a',&nbsp;3&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;"aaa"<br>
2061     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;'a',&nbsp;-2&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;""<br>
2062     *  </code>
2063     *
2064     *  @param  codePoint   The character to repeat.
2065     *  @param  repeat  The number of times to repeat {@code c}; a negative
2066     *      value will be treated as zero.
2067     *  @return A new String consisting of the given character repeated
2068     *      {@code repeat} times, or the empty String if {@code repeat} was 0
2069     *      or negative, or {@code null} if the code point is invalid.
2070     *
2071     *  @see Character#isValidCodePoint(int)
2072     *  @see String#repeat(int)
2073     *
2074     *  @since 0.0.5
2075     */
2076    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
2077    public static final String repeat( final int codePoint, final int repeat )
2078    {
2079        final var retValue = (repeat > 0)
2080            ? isValidCodePoint( codePoint )
2081                ? Character.toString( codePoint ).repeat( repeat ).intern()
2082                : null
2083            : EMPTY_STRING;
2084
2085        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2086        return retValue;
2087    }   //  repeat()
2088
2089    /**
2090     *  Repeats the given String {@code repeat} times to form a new String. The
2091     *  table below shows the various  result for some argument
2092     *  combinations.<br>
2093     *  <br><code>
2094     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;null,&nbsp;2&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;null<br>
2095     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;"",&nbsp;0&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;""<br>
2096     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;"",&nbsp;2&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;""<br>
2097     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;"a",&nbsp;3&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;"aaa"<br>
2098     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;"ab",&nbsp;2&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;"abab"<br>
2099     *  StringUtils.repeat(&nbsp;"a",&nbsp;-2&nbsp;)&nbsp;&rArr;&nbsp;""<br>
2100     *  </code>
2101     *
2102     *  @param  s The String to repeat, may be {@code null}.
2103     *  @param repeat   The number of times to repeat {@code str}; a negative
2104     *      value will be treated as zero.
2105     *  @return A new String consisting of the original String repeated,
2106     *      {@code repeat} times, the empty String if {@code repeat} was 0
2107     *      or negative, or {@code null} if the input String was
2108     *      {@code null}, too.
2109     *
2110     *  @see String#repeat(int)
2111     *
2112     *  @since 0.0.5
2113     */
2114    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
2115    public static final String repeat( final CharSequence s, final int repeat )
2116    {
2117        final var retValue =
2118            nonNull( s )
2119                ? (repeat > 0) && !s.isEmpty()
2120                    ? s.toString().repeat( repeat )
2121                    : EMPTY_STRING
2122                : null;
2123
2124        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2125        return retValue;
2126    }   //  repeat()
